column4: well its up to you, either change the init.d directly or get xubuntu-desktop package which has service-admin
check the forums?
check your compiler (gcc) in synaptic
and mark it to reinstall or fix broken dependencies
mojojo fix broken dependencies
say pop up Synaptic and look at this --->  xubuntu-system-tools I think this might have that
well I was looking at rcconf and bum but those aren't listed so I guess just disable the files in /etc/init.d then
I don't see any service-admin in Synaptic coming up
dont apt-get that
ahh
ok, plus that is Ubuntu's version of XFce if I want to run it yea?
ok thanks
otherwise if I want to just disable the scripts you have to like chmod -x to disable them
You should use update-rc.d to disable services from starting up if you dont use xubuntu
ok

since Ubuntu has gdm installed for Gnome, then what do you use to boot into xubuntu as a graphical manager to boot either Gnome or XFce? I know how to do all of this by xinitrc but I thought I'd go the display manager bootup....
with update-rc.d it seems you need to know the runlevels, but how do you just stop something like lvm, what cmd would you use for it?
ok so do the same for all the others like that I want to disable?
ok thanks, and one last one, then if I wanted to enable it, how would I run it?
what is your definition of a bootup service I don't follow
ok so --->  update-rc.d lvm defaults ?
what did you mean by bootup services, everything that is in /etc/init.d does bootup at startup, so to me I would call that/all of them bootup services
